analyzed: so sor thar pa dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun la spo bar byed pa'i dge slong bsko bar bya'o //

original: des kyang ji ltar gyur pa brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: de dag gis kyang ma nus na rtsod pa sbed par byed pa de gnyis la gtad do //

original: des mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa la spo'o //
analyzed: des mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa la spo'o //

original: de dag gis kyang ma nus na de nyid la'o //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang ma nus na de nyid la'o //
translated: If they are unable to do so, he should be transferred to them.🔽If they are unable to do so, he should be transferred to the place where the chief elder

analyzed: des kyang ma nus na gang na gnas brtan gtso bo 'am /
translated: If you are still unable to do this, then go to the place where the most senior monk is staying.

original: shes pa de la mtha' nye bar bzung nas gtad par bya'o //🔽des de dag la ci yang bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa de la mtha' nye bar bzung nas gtad par bya'o // des de dag la ci yang bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the arbiter should be seated in such a way that he is near to the one who is speaking.🔽He should not take the side of either party.

original: kha ton la sogs pa sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha ton la sogs pa sbyin par mi bya'o //

analyzed: mdun nam rgyab tu 'dug na ma 'gyed shig ma 'thab shig / gnyi ga rgyal ba med kyi /

original: 'on kyang gcig pu la bya'o zhes de skad nyi tshe smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig pu la bya'o zhes de skad nyi tshe smra bar bya'o //

analyzed: des zhi bar gyur na legs par zhi ba zhes bya ba ste ; de ltar na mngon sum gyis 'dul ba yin no //

original: gal te gnas brtan gyis kyang ma nus na des spo bar byed pa nyid la gtad par bya'o //🔽des kyang dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas brtan gyis kyang ma nus na des spo bar byed pa nyid la gtad par bya'o // des kyang dge 'dun la'o //
translated: If he is not able to settle it, then the dispute is settled by the majority.🔽If the elder is not able to settle the dispute, then the dispute is settled by the one who is the most senior monk who is able to settle it.🔽If he is not able to settle it, then the dispute is settled by the majority.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang tshul shing mang po len du bcug nas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang tshul shing mang po len du bcug nas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: If the majority is not able to settle it, then the dispute is settled by a vote using ballots.

original: rnam pa ldar don sbyin par byed pa dang / don slar sbyin par byed pa dag gis rtsub bar gzung ba'i phyir de ltar na rtsub pa can dang / gdug par byed pa'i phyir de ltar gdug pa can dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar na dam po can dang /
analyzed: rnam pa ldar don sbyin par byed pa dang / don slar sbyin par byed pa dag gis rtsub bar gzung ba'i phyir de ltar na rtsub pa can dang / gdug par byed pa'i phyir de ltar gdug pa can dang / rab tu 'dzin pa'i phyir de ltar na dam po can dang /
translated: It is harsh because it is held to be harsh by giving the meaning of the words and by giving the meaning of the words again. It is cruel because it is cruel. It is tight because it is tight.

original: dbye bar byed pa'i gzhi bcu bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir dbye ba'i @263a * //
analyzed: dbye bar byed pa'i gzhi bcu bzhi 'dzin pa'i phyir dbye ba'i @263a * //
translated: It is divisive because it holds the fourteen foundations of division.

original: bsam pa can dang gnas brtan gyi mthar thug gi bar du phyin kyang sbyor ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa can dang gnas brtan gyi mthar thug gi bar du phyin kyang sbyor ba gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not applied elsewhere even until the end of the elders.

original: tshul shing brim pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshul shing brim pa la rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of distribution of the voting stick:

original: gang na gnas brtan chos bzhin du mi smra ba mang ba der ni dgab par bya ba dang go bzlog pa der ni gsal bar bya ba dang / gang na rna drung du khyod kyi mkhan po des ni chos kyi tshul shing blangs kyi khyod kyis longs shig ces bsgo ba dang /

translated: In a place where the elder does not speak in accordance with the Dharma, it is to be concealed. In a place where the opposite is true, it is to be made clear. In a place where the elder is not present, it is to be announced. In a place where the elder is present, it is to be announced.

original: gang na nad pa mang zhing dge 'dun thams cad kyi dang bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gang na nad pa mang zhing dge 'dun thams cad kyi dang bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is where there are many sick people and all the Saṅgha members are sick.

original: tshul shing brim pa chos dang ldan pa ma yin par len pa bcu ste /
analyzed: tshul shing brim pa chos dang ldan pa ma yin par len pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten ways of taking the voting stick that are not in accordance with the Dharma:

original: chos ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa dang / ma 'dus par len pa dang / chung zad tsam gyis lhung ba chung dus dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mthar ma phyin par sbyor ba gzhan du bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: chos ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul pa dang rjes su mi mthun pa dang / ma 'dus par len pa dang / chung zad tsam gyis lhung ba chung dus dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mthar ma phyin par sbyor ba gzhan du bzlog pa dang /
translated: taking it in an unrighteous way, not in accordance with the Vinaya, not in a unified way, fearing a minor downfall from a minor cause, changing to another activity before the end of the elder’s turn,

original: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa kha lo sgyur bar byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi 'dri ba dang dge 'dun dbye bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du 'du shes pa dang / dge slong ches rab tu mang po dag chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur bar shes pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa dang mi ldan pa kha lo sgyur bar byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa la mi 'dri ba dang dge 'dun dbye bar bya ba'i phyir ro snyam du 'du shes pa dang / dge slong ches rab tu mang po dag chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur bar shes pa dang /
translated: not being in agreement, not asking the Vinaya master and so on, thinking that one should divide the Saṅgha, knowing that a great many monks will speak unrighteously,

original: dge 'dun dbye bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun dbye bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'o //
translated: and The Saṅgha will be split and Wouldn't it be good if they spoke Dharma?

original: go bzlog pa bcu ni chos yin no //
analyzed: go bzlog pa bcu ni chos yin no //
translated: The opposite of these ten is Dharma.

original: tshul shing brim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su bya ste /
analyzed: tshul shing brim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su bya ste /
translated: The voting tickets are of two kinds: Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: chos kyi tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni slar bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs phun sum tshogs pa dang / chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni slar bzlog pa'o //
translated: The Dharma ticket is well-shaped, well-colored, and well-formed. The non-Dharma ticket is the opposite.

original: chos kyi tshul shing lag pa g-yas par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul shing lag pa g-yas par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The Dharma ticket should be held in the right hand.

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon par ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon par ro //
translated: The non-Dharma ticket should be held in the left hand.

original: de nas mdun du 'dug la bsngags pa dang / mi bsngags pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mdun du 'dug la bsngags pa dang / mi bsngags pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting in front of them, both the praise and the blame should be spoken.

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing gi phyir lag pa brkyang na tshig dang po dang gnyis kyi bar du sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing gi phyir lag pa brkyang na tshig dang po dang gnyis kyi bar du sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If the hand is extended for the non-Dharma ticket, it should not be given between the first and second statements.

original: gsum pa la sbyin te 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya'o //🔽gal te chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis kyang nyul bar 'gyur na kun shes koondi n+ya'i phyir gcig blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la sbyin te 'dul ba dang 'gal ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya'o // gal te chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis kyang nyul bar 'gyur na kun shes koondi n+ya'i phyir gcig blang bar bya'o //
translated: and the third, one should confess the faults that violate the Vinaya.🔽If the dispute is settled by a single Dharma-staff, then one should take up a single staff for the sake of Ājñātakauṇḍinya.

original: gal te chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis lhag par gyur na chos kyis rtsod pa zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis lhag par gyur na chos kyis rtsod pa zhi ba yin te /
translated: If the Dharma-staff is in excess, then the dispute is settled by the Dharma.

original: gang chos kyis skyo sngogs byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: gang chos kyis skyo sngogs byed na ltung byed do //

analyzed: gal @263b te chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing blangs par 'gyur na yang chos ma yin pas zhi ba yin te /

original: de yang skyo sngogs byas na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de yang skyo sngogs byas na nyes byas so //
translated: If one disputes the Dharma, then there is an offense.

original: de ltar na gang tshul shing mang po brim pas zhi bar gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gang tshul shing mang po brim pas zhi bar gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, a dispute is settled by the many Dharma-staffs.

analyzed: mi bsdams pa'i phyir rtsod pa ni zhi bar rnam pa gsum gyis zhi bar bya ste /

analyzed: 'gyed pa'i phyir rtsod pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis 'dul ba dang / dran pas 'dul ba ste /
translated: by confession, like a dispute in a debate; by resolution through recollection;🔽and by resolution through the majority decision.

analyzed: ji ltar gyang bu nor la dge slong dag gis gzhi des glengs pas na /

original: ngo tsha ba'i phyir gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las kyis dran bas 'dul ba sbyin pa dang / de bzhin du de la ltung ba gzhan byung na gzhan gyis glengs pa na ltung ba phyir bcos pa byas pa yang ngo //

original: ma smyos pas 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: ma smyos pas 'dul ba ste /
translated: The trial period for the insane is granted to one who is not insane.

analyzed: ci ltar bye ma skyes la /

analyzed: smyos pa'i tshe byas pa glengs pa'i phyir gsol ba dang / las brjod pa gsum gyis ma smyos pas 'dul ba sbyin pa'o //

analyzed: chos ma yin par dran pas 'dul ba sbyin pa la gsum ste /

analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ma smyos par 'dul ba sbyin par 'os so //

analyzed: gsum pa la ni de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug par 'os so //

analyzed: chos ma yin par ma smyos pas 'dul ba sbyin par 'os pa gcig ste /
translated: There is one fit to be given a penance for the insane, not for the insane.

analyzed: gad smyos pa ma yin pas na bdag smyos so zhes khas len pa'o //
translated: Since he is not insane, he admits, “I am insane.”

analyzed: ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa zhi bar 'gyur ba rnam pa bzhis zhi bar byas te /

analyzed: de la khas blang par bya ba ni ci ltar ltung ba byung ba la glengs sam ma glengs kyang rung /
translated: In this regard, the admission is as follows: Whether or not a downfall has been confessed,

original: dran par byas sam dran par ma byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dran par byas sam dran par ma byas kyang rung ste /
translated: whether or not it is remembered,

original: dge slong gi mdun du tshul bzhin du 'chags pa 'di ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi mdun du tshul bzhin du 'chags pa 'di ni khas blangs pa'o //

analyzed: chos ma yin par khas len du sbyin pa bcu ste /

original: bsnyon pa la khas len pa dang / khas blangs pa las yang bsnyon pa de la ni gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis sbyin par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsnyon pa la khas len pa dang / khas blangs pa las yang bsnyon pa de la ni gsol ba dang / gnyis kyi las kyis sbyin par bya ba ste /

original: de ni chos bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni chos bzhin pa'o //

original: khas blangs ba las bsnyon pa las yang khas len pa 'di ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khas blangs ba las bsnyon pa las yang khas len pa 'di ni chos bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: If one admits it and then denies it again, that is improper.

analyzed: de la rtsva bkram pa lta bu ni phyogs gnyis su chad de gnas pa las phyogs kyi gtso bo dag gis rang rang gi phyogs la bsgo ste /
translated: In the case of the penance like a spread of grass, one who is divided into two factions and remains in that way, the leaders of each faction should admonish their own faction.

original: phyogs pha rol po la bzod par byas te ltung ba 'ang bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs pha rol po la bzod par byas te ltung ba 'ang bshags par bya'o //

original: de la lhag pa 'khrug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la lhag pa 'khrug par 'gyur //

analyzed: gal te gnyis sam gsum gang yang rung ba dus byas pa 'am /

analyzed: de lta bas na gang gi tshigs su bcad pa gcig bklag kyang des chos dkon mchog gi rnyed ba yongs su longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if you read only one verse, you will have made full use of the opportunity to find the jewel of the Dharma.

analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //

analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang smras pa /

analyzed: rtsod pa rnam pa bdun la zhi bar byed pa bdun du gnas te /

analyzed: rtsod @264b pa bdun po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the seven disputes?

analyzed: ltung ba las brtsams te mtshan nyid khas mi len pas na rtsod pa dang / byas pa khas mi len pas rtsod pa dang / rang dbang med par khas mi len pas rtsod pa dang / brtags nas khas blangs pa la khas mi len pas rtsod pa dang khas blangs nas smyon pa'i phyir rtsod pa dang ;

analyzed: mtshan ma las rtsod pa dang / nga rgyal gyi phyogs kyis rtsod pa'o //

analyzed: de la dge 'dun gyis ltung ba dang ltung ba med pa'i mtshan nyid brtags te glengs nas shogs shig ces bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: If he admits to the act, but not to the characteristics of a pārājika, then the Saṅgha should investigate the characteristics of the offense and of the non-offense, and order him to confess.

original: yang na gleng ba dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gleng ba dgag par bya ste /
translated: Or else, the accusation should be stopped.

analyzed: de ltar na rtsod pa mngon sum du 'dul bas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, a dispute should be settled by the application of the vinaya in the presence of the accused.

analyzed: gzhan yang gang dang gang byas pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dgos pas glengs nas byas pa de rnams mi dran zhes smra na /

analyzed: de dge 'dun gyis gleng ba'i dge slong tshul khrims dang cho ga dang 'brel ba brtags la /

analyzed: glengs pa de'i dran pa la dran pas 'dul bas rtsod pa de zhi bar bya'o //

analyzed: ltung ba med pa de'i ngo bo nyid rtogs la gang de'i ngo bo nyid tshol du gzhug pas gang rtsod pa zhi bar byas pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar khas blangs pas rtsod pa de zhi ba yin no //

analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos dang mthun pa nan tan tu byed pa'i chos zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase the Dharma that accords with the Dharma means the Dharma that is practiced in accordance with the Dharma of nirvana.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi nyan thos rnams ni dka' thub dka' ba la lhag par mos par 'gyur te /🔽de dag kyang dka' thub dka' ba la nan tan du byed cing de'i 'bras bu dang / de ston pa la lhag par mos nas de yang de bzhin du lhag bar mos te gal te las rnying pa rnams ni dka' thub kyis zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs kyi nyan thos rnams ni dka' thub dka' ba la lhag par mos par 'gyur te / de dag kyang dka' thub dka' ba la nan tan du byed cing de'i 'bras bu dang / de ston pa la lhag par mos nas de yang de bzhin du lhag bar mos te gal te las rnying pa rnams ni dka' thub kyis zad par 'gyur /
translated: The disciples of the Perfectly Awakened One Vipaśyin were devoted to austerities and difficult practices.🔽They were devoted to the practice of austerities and difficult practices and, having attained the result of that practice, they were devoted to the teacher who had taught it.

original: las sar ba rnams ni ma byas nas chu lon bzhin te /
analyzed: las sar ba rnams ni ma byas nas chu lon bzhin te /
translated: They believed that if one's old karma is exhausted through austerities and one does not create new karma, then one is like a dam that has been breached.

original: de ltar na tshe phyi ma zag pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na tshe phyi ma zag pa med do //
translated: In this way, one's future life will be free of any outflows.

original: zag ba med bas na las zad /
analyzed: zag ba med bas na las zad /
translated: Because there are no outflows, karma is exhausted.

original: las zad pas na sdug bsngal zad /
analyzed: las zad pas na sdug bsngal zad /
translated: Because karma is exhausted, suffering is exhausted.

original: sdug bsngal zad pas na sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pas na sdug bsngal mthar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since suffering is exhausted, one becomes an ender of suffering.🔽One who teaches in this way is a monk.

original: gang de ltar ston pa de ni dge sbyong yin no zhes de lta bur lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: gang de ltar ston pa de ni dge sbyong yin no zhes de lta bur lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught this Pratimoksa to his disciples as an antidote to such excessive beliefs.

original: bzod ba dka' thub @266a * //
analyzed: bzod ba dka' thub @266a * //
translated: Patience is the highest austerity.🔽This is stated in detail in the verse, “Patience is the highest austerity.

original: dam pa zhes bya bar rgya cher ro //
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya bar rgya cher ro //
translated: and the Subahupariprccha.🔽

original: de la dka' thub dka' ba la lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni bzod pa dka' thub dam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dka' thub dka' ba la lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por gsungs pa ni bzod pa dka' thub dam pa'o //
translated: The Buddha taught this as an antidote to excessive belief in the difficulty of austerity.

original: lus gdung ba las ma yin no //
analyzed: lus gdung ba las ma yin no //
translated: It is not in the tormenting of the body.

original: sems gdung ba de nyid goms par bya bar mchog tu dka' ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i 'bras bu la lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bzod pa'i /
analyzed: sems gdung ba de nyid goms par bya bar mchog tu dka' ba'i phyir ro // de'i 'bras bu la lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bzod pa'i /
translated: Because it is most difficult to cultivate the torment of the mind.🔽The Buddha taught this as an antidote to excessive belief in the result of austerity.

original: mya ngan 'das pa mchog ces sangs rgyas gsungs //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa mchog ces sangs rgyas gsungs //
translated: Patience is the highest nirvana.🔽This is stated in the verse, “Patience is the highest nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.🔽🔽

original: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa 'dod pa de ni 'dir bzod pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa 'dod pa de ni 'dir bzod pa zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Here, patience is intended to mean the patience that is the discernment of phenomena.

original: gang la brten te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gang la brten te mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is based on that.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni dam pa ste rtag tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni dam pa ste rtag tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme means highest, because it is always virtuous.

original: ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba thob kyi dka' thub dka' bas ma yin pas na /
analyzed: ye shes kyis mya ngan las 'da' ba thob kyi dka' thub dka' bas ma yin pas na /
translated: One attains nirvana through wisdom, not through the hardship of austerities.

original: de de ltar na bzod pas 'thob pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: de de ltar na bzod pas 'thob pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: Thus, the nirvana that is attained through patience

original: bzod pa'i mya ngan 'da' ba zhes bya ba tshig bar ma phyi mas bstan to //
analyzed: bzod pa'i mya ngan 'da' ba zhes bya ba tshig bar ma phyi mas bstan to //
translated: is called the nirvana of patience, as indicated by the second half of the verse.

original: de skad ston pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: de skad ston pa'i gnyen por /
translated: In order to teach that, he says

original: rab tu byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs ba gsungs te /
translated: Those who are not renunciates, etc.

original: gang lus gdung bar don med pa la gzhan nye bar gdung du 'jug par byed pa de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa de dag dge sbyong ma yin te /
analyzed: gang lus gdung bar don med pa la gzhan nye bar gdung du 'jug par byed pa de ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa de dag dge sbyong ma yin te /
translated: Those who cause others to suffer through useless self-mortification are not ascetics, because they harm others.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan la log par sbyor bas sbyor ba brtsams te spyod par byed pa 'che ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan la log par sbyor bas sbyor ba brtsams te spyod par byed pa 'che ba yin no //
translated: However, they are indeed ascetics in that they engage in the practice of misusing others.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gtsug tor can gyi nyan thos rnams ni phal cher mtho ris su smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par sbyad ba lhag bar mos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gtsug tor can gyi nyan thos rnams ni phal cher mtho ris su smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par sbyad ba lhag bar mos par 'gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Perfectly Awakened One Śikhin mostly made aspirations for rebirth in the higher realms and were inclined to the practice of celibacy.

original: de ltar lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des /
analyzed: de ltar lhag par mos pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des /
translated: The Blessed One, as an antidote to that inclination, said:

original: so sor thar pa'i mig ldan nyam pa bdag ji bzhin du //🔽zhes bya ba 'di rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mig ldan nyam pa bdag ji bzhin du // zhes bya ba 'di rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: “Those who have the eye of the Prātimokṣa, who are careful, and who are like me,🔽should not be inclined to the practice of celibacy.”

original: de la shes rab ni mig gi gnas lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab ni mig gi gnas lta bu'o //
translated: Here, wisdom is like the eye.

original: de dang ldan pas na mig ldan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas na mig ldan zhes bya ste /
translated: Those who have it are said to have eyes.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga dang 'brel to //
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gnyi ga dang 'brel to //
translated: The word “like” is connected with both.

original: nyam nga ba dang 'dra ba ni mtho ris yin te /
analyzed: nyam nga ba dang 'dra ba ni mtho ris yin te /
translated: The higher realms are like a dangerous place.

original: der spyod pa ni ngan song gi 'gro bar ltung bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: der spyod pa ni ngan song gi 'gro bar ltung bar 'gyur ro /
translated: Those who practice there will fall into the destinies of the lower realms.

original: 'gro ba yod pa'i zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das ba ni 'gro ba dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba yod pa'i zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das ba ni 'gro ba dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The phrase “in the world” means that nirvāṇa is like a world.

original: mkhas dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mkhas dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “the wise”

original: thabs la mkhas pa'o ;
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'o ;
translated: refers to those who are skilled in means.

original: / sdig pa dag ni yongs su spang //
analyzed: / sdig pa dag ni yongs su spang //
translated: “Abandon evil deeds.🔽”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: mtho ris su smon ba las slar bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris su smon ba las slar bzlog pa'o //
translated: the reversal of the aspiration for heaven.

original: gang sdig pa'i byed pa tho ba pas mtho ris su 'dod pa des ni sdig pa spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang sdig pa'i byed pa tho ba pas mtho ris su 'dod pa des ni sdig pa spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who desire heaven through the performance of evil deeds do not abandon evil.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad skyob de'i nyan thos rnams ni tshul khrims tsam gyis @266b mgu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad skyob de'i nyan thos rnams ni tshul khrims tsam gyis @266b mgu bar 'gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the Perfectly Awakened One Viśvabhū were satisfied with mere morality.

original: gzhan dag kyang nyes par bshags par zhugs pa rnams la de dag skur pa 'debs shing ngag dang yid kyis de dag la gnod par byed la /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang nyes par bshags par zhugs pa rnams la de dag skur pa 'debs shing ngag dang yid kyis de dag la gnod par byed la /
translated: They slandered those who had undertaken to confess their faults, and they harmed them with their speech and thoughts.

original: bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims tsam gyis mgu bas na dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang tshul khrims tsam gyis mgu bas na dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yang thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Since they were satisfied with mere morality, they did not even attain the fruit of asceticism.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa de'i gnyen por nyan thos rnams dang so sor thar pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyes pa de'i gnyen por nyan thos rnams dang so sor thar pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught this Prātimokṣa for his disciples as an antidote to that fault.

original: de la skur pa 'dabs pa'i gnyen por /
analyzed: de la skur pa 'dabs pa'i gnyen por /
translated: Therein, as an antidote to slander,

original: skur pa mi 'debs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skur pa mi 'debs zhes gsungs so //
translated: he taught, “Do not slander.”

original: yid kyis gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gnod mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yid kyis gnod pa byed pa'i gnyen por gnod mi bya zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to mental harm is stated in “do not harm.”

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i gnyen por so sor thar pa 'ang zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so//
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i gnyen por so sor thar pa 'ang zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs so//
translated: The antidote to not attaining the fruits of asceticism is stated in “also the pratimokṣa” and so on.

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas 'dod pas bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor pa'i mtha' gnyis spongs la zhi ba'i gnas su zhugs te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims la brten nas 'dod pas bsod nams dang / bdag nyid dub pa la sbyor pa'i mtha' gnyis spongs la zhi ba'i gnas su zhugs te /
translated: Based on the morality that is oriented toward nirvana, abandon the two extremes of engaging in the exhaustion of one’s body through desire and the exhaustion of one’s body through austerities and enter the state of peace.

original: zhi gnas la brten nas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas la brten nas thar bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Based on meditative serenity, one will attain liberation.🔽The listeners of the perfectly complete Buddha Kanakamuni mostly desired gain and honor.🔽The Blessed One taught the listeners the pratimokṣa🔽as an antidote to desire.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas log par dad sel gyi nyan thos rnams la phal cher rnyed pa dang bkur sti la 'dod par gyur de 'dod pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas log par dad sel gyi nyan thos rnams la phal cher rnyed pa dang bkur sti la 'dod par gyur de 'dod pa'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa /
translated: The Buddha taught the following verses to the listeners of the perfectly complete Buddha Kanakamuni:

original: ji ltar bung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar bung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: “Just as bees gather pollen🔽and build up honey for their own use,🔽so too should you gather the teachings🔽and build up the aggregates of virtue for your own use.

original: kha dog ni dge sbyong gi tshul khrims yin te /
analyzed: kha dog ni dge sbyong gi tshul khrims yin te /
translated: Color is the morality of the ascetic,

original: des ni mdzes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni mdzes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for by it one becomes beautiful.

original: dri ni ting nge 'dzin te sbyor ba phra mos tshim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ni ting nge 'dzin te sbyor ba phra mos tshim par 'gyur ro //
translated: Smell is meditative concentration, for one is satisfied by subtle engagement.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gser thub kyi nyan thos rnams las phal cher skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gser thub kyi nyan thos rnams las phal cher skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The disciples of the perfectly awakened Buddha Kanakamuni were mostly engaged in the Dharma of the holy men.

original: de dag bdag nyid la ni bstod /
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid la ni bstod /
translated: They praised themselves

original: pha rol po rnams la yang smod par byed cing /
analyzed: pha rol po rnams la yang smod par byed cing /
translated: and disparaged others.

original: de rnams ni thos pa'i longs spyod la brtsams te ;
analyzed: de rnams ni thos pa'i longs spyod la brtsams te ;
translated: They began to enjoy learning,

original: 'bel pa'i gtam rnam par nges pa la gzhan dag la mi mthun par brjod pas na /
analyzed: 'bel pa'i gtam rnam par nges pa la gzhan dag la mi mthun par brjod pas na /
translated: and they spoke in opposition to others about the extensive teachings and ascertainment.

original: bcom ldan 'das des de'i gnyen por gzhan rnams kyi mi mthun pa min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des de'i gnyen por gzhan rnams kyi mi mthun pa min zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat said this in opposition to that: “Do not speak in opposition to others.”

original: tshul khrims kyi longs spyod las brtsams te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi longs spyod las brtsams te /
translated: He spoke this in opposition to those who began to enjoy the pleasures of morality.

original: gzhan rnams la byas pa dang / ma byas pa sbyor ba'i ltung ba la rtog pas na gzhan dag gi / byas dang ma byas rnams la min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la byas pa dang / ma byas pa sbyor ba'i ltung ba la rtog pas na gzhan dag gi / byas dang ma byas rnams la min // zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He is not concerned with what others have done or not done.🔽The remedy for the former is stated:

original: snga ma'i gnyen po yang bdag gi las rtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽rigs dang mi rigs rnams la yang //
analyzed: snga ma'i gnyen po yang bdag gi las rtag par bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // rigs dang mi rigs rnams la yang //
translated: I will always do my own work.🔽With regard to what is right and wrong,

original: zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go @267a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go @267a * //
translated: means what is well done and what is badly done.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi nyan thos rnams las phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srungs kyi nyan thos rnams las phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang bar gyur nas /
translated: Most of the disciples of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, having savored the taste of meditative concentration,🔽became attached to it.🔽The Blessed One taught the Prātimokṣa

original: nyes pa de'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa /
analyzed: nyes pa de'i gnyen por bcom ldan 'das des so sor thar pa /
translated: as the remedy for that fault:

original: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //🔽zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste // zhes bya ba 'di gsungs so //
translated: Be careful with your higher mind.

original: lhag pa'i sems la bag med pa ma byed cig ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la bag med pa ma byed cig ces bya ba yin no //
translated: This means: “Do not be careless with your higher mind.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi ro myang ba las bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of relishing the taste of meditative concentration.

original: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //
analyzed: thub pa'i thub gzhi rnams la bslab //
translated: One should train in the bases of the Muni.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa las 'jug pa'o //🔽bden pa dag ni thub pa'i gzhi rnams te //
analyzed: bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa las 'jug pa'o // bden pa dag ni thub pa'i gzhi rnams te //
translated: the entry into the realization of the truths.🔽The truths are the bases of the Muni.

original: thub pa'i skye mched du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i skye mched du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They become the bases of the Muni.

original: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin //
analyzed: skyob pa mya ngan med pa yin //
translated: The Protector is without sorrow.

original: nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
analyzed: nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa'i //
translated: He is always mindful of peace.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden pa mthong ba'i phan yon bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the benefits of seeing the truths.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin thob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin thob tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though one has attained meditative concentration,

original: dus de srid du mya ngan rnams med par gyur te /
analyzed: dus de srid du mya ngan rnams med par gyur te /
translated: for that length of time one is without sorrow.

original: ting nge 'dzin ma nyams pas nyon mongs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / dran pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur mod kyi tshe phyi ma la mi slar yang mya ngan du 'gyur ba dang / slar yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma nyams pas nyon mongs pa rnams nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba dang / dran pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur mod kyi tshe phyi ma la mi slar yang mya ngan du 'gyur ba dang / slar yang zhi bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: One becomes peaceful through the non-degeneration of meditative concentration, and one becomes mindful. But in the next life, one will again have sorrow, and one will not again become peaceful.

original: yang brjed pa'i chos yin pas na dran pa dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang brjed pa'i chos yin pas na dran pa dang ldan par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, since it is a dharma of forgetting, it would not be endowed with mindfulness.

original: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gang zag gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma spang pa'i rim pa sbyin pas zhes bya la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i gang zag gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma spang pa'i rim pa sbyin pas zhes bya la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The remaining stages of abandoning the higher portion of the fetters of the person who has realized the truth are indicated by the verse beginning with “generosity.”

original: de la tshigs gsum gyis ni 'dod pa na sbyod pa'i kun du sbyor ba spang ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshigs gsum gyis ni 'dod pa na sbyod pa'i kun du sbyor ba spang ba ste /
translated: Among those, the three lines indicate the abandonment of the fetters that are experienced in the desire realm.

original: 'di ltar phongs pa dang / dri ma dang / 'jungs ba dang bral bas gtong ba bskyed de /🔽'phags pa rnams dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la slob pa'i tshe snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge ba'i stobs kyis sdig pa'i ming du bya ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phongs pa dang / dri ma dang / 'jungs ba dang bral bas gtong ba bskyed de / 'phags pa rnams dgyes pa'i tshul khrims la slob pa'i tshe snyoms par 'jug pa'i dge ba'i stobs kyis sdig pa'i ming du bya ba /
translated: Thus, by being free from poverty, stains, and miserliness, one generates generosity.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i las dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i las dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: When training in the ethics that please the āryas, through the power of the virtue of meditative equipoise, one abandons the nonvirtue that is called “the karma and affliction of the afflictions experienced in the desire realm.”

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zad nas mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zad nas mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: Having exhausted the afflictions, one attains nirvāṇa.

original: khams gsum gyi kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi kun du sbyor ba thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: They have abandoned all the fetters of the three realms.
